p: The concentrations of C15:0 (p = 0.003), C16:0 (p = 0.045), C17:0 (p = 0.027), C21:0 (p<0.001), C24:0 (p<0.001), and as a consequence, of total SFA (p = 0.049) were significantly lower in MLD in the group receiving linseed oil than in the control group ( Table 5). When linseed oil was added to the diet, C24:0 concentration in MS was significantly lower (p = 0.006) as compared to the control ration ( Table 6). Total SFA in MS was not influenced by oil supplementations (p = 0.975).
